definition[0]: to move slowly from one side to another
example[0]: The trees swayed gently in the breeze.
definition[1]: to influence someone so that they change their opinion
example[1]: Don’t allow yourself to be swayed by his promises.
definition[2]: power to rule or influence people
example[2]: These old attitudes still hold sway in the church.
example[3]: She was now completely under his sway.
definition[3]: a swinging movement from side to side
